alert.note: Alert for Upper Koyukuk Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 04 at 3:15AM AKST until February 04 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST TODAY... * WHAT...Blowing and drifting snow with low visibility and wind chills to 45 below expected. Plan on areas of poor visibilities to create difficult travel conditions at times. Visibility one half mile or less at times. * WHERE...On Dalton Highway Summits and near Indian Mountain. * WHEN...Until noon today. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds gusting to 45 mph will cause areas of blowing and drifting snow. Large snow drifts will form. Cold wind chills as low as 45 below zero will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for blowing snow means periods of blowing snow will cause travel difficulties. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
